exam.summary: During high warp, the intermix chamber begins oscillating beyond tolerance limits.

answers.text: Stabilize the reaction by recalibrating magnetic constrictors and gradually reducing power to zero-point margin.
answers.details: Methodical and safe; preserves containment while preventing full shutdown damage.

answers.text: Bypass the safety interlocks and vent plasma to space to cool the core faster.
answers.details: Endangers crew and violates core safety protocols; could destabilize warp containment.

answers.text: Shift plasma flow through auxiliary manifolds while preparing a backup warp field to absorb load.
answers.details: A clever approach that maintains control but risks subsystem overload if prolonged.

exam.summary: A sudden EPS grid overload disables life support in two decks.

answers.text: Isolate damaged EPS relays, reroute power manually, and coordinate with environmental systems.
answers.details: Textbook crisis management that protects lives and maintains system integrity.

answers.text: Cut power to the entire grid and attempt a cold restart of ship systems.
answers.details: Effective but risks losing critical control subsystems during restart.

answers.text: Increase power throughput to compensate for failing relays.
answers.details: Would worsen the overload and cause additional system failures.

exam.summary: A matter stream destabilizes mid-transport with a crew member in transit.

answers.text: Engage pattern buffer isolation and manually rephase the matter stream using harmonic feedback.
answers.details: Shows precision control and calm response; protects molecular integrity.

answers.text: Abort the transport and attempt a secondary beam-in from backup coordinates.
answers.details: Sometimes effective but risks fragmentation if the buffer remains unstable.

answers.text: Deactivate the system and reboot the transporter control matrix immediately.
answers.details: Interrupting during active dematerialization could result in fatal pattern loss.

exam.summary: Sensors detect small but increasing structural fractures along the secondary hull.

answers.text: Deploy structural integrity fields and initiate automated microsealant drones to contain damage.
answers.details: Efficient, safe, and minimally invasive to ship operations.

answers.text: Divert warp power directly into hull reinforcement emitters.
answers.details: Unsafe energy transfer may trigger cascade failures in secondary conduits.

answers.text: Conduct a full scan to identify the stress points, then schedule an EVA patching team.
answers.details: Procedurally sound though slower; prioritizes diagnostics over speed.

exam.summary: An alien program infiltrates the ship’s main computer, altering diagnostic subroutines.

answers.text: Isolate the affected subroutines and restore control from an independent system core image.
answers.details: Restores functionality safely without compromising ship data.

answers.text: Purge all computer memory to guarantee removal of the intrusion.
answers.details: Effective but results in catastrophic data loss and system downtime.

answers.text: Attempt to trace the alien signal while the system is still operational.
answers.details: Risky; further contamination could spread through linked control subsystems.

exam.summary: A harmonic imbalance threatens to tear the ship’s warp bubble apart mid-flight.

answers.text: Shut down warp drive immediately and vent residual plasma through impulse manifolds.
answers.details: Prioritizes containment and safety before reestablishing warp symmetry.

answers.text: Adjust the phase variance to counter the imbalance and continue at reduced warp.
answers.details: Technically sound but risky if imbalance exceeds tolerance before correction.

answers.text: Ignore the fluctuations until reaching the next navigational checkpoint.
answers.details: Neglecting warp instability invites catastrophic field collapse.

exam.summary: Radiation from a nearby pulsar is degrading the impulse drive injectors.

answers.text: Reroute the magnetic shielding matrix and cycle impulse injectors through secondary channels.
answers.details: Practical engineering fix that preserves thrust control.

answers.text: Shut down impulse systems and rely solely on thrusters until the radiation subsides.
answers.details: Safe but inefficient; may limit maneuverability during hazard avoidance.

answers.text: Maintain impulse output to burn through the contamination faster.
answers.details: Accelerates degradation and could permanently damage drive components.

exam.summary: An unexplained surge causes all replicators to malfunction simultaneously.

answers.text: Cut power to the replicator grid and perform a phased diagnostic of the EPS relays.
answers.details: Demonstrates composure and systematic analysis under pressure.

answers.text: Order all personnel to avoid replicator use until the surge resolves itself.
answers.details: Passivity wastes time and may allow system instability to spread.

answers.text: Bypass the faulty power distribution node and reroute through cargo bay substations.
answers.details: Restores function temporarily; acceptable short-term workaround.
